Amazing food. I have not been for almost 10 years, and the food and service is still as good now as it was then. Well worth a visit.

Good food and polite/welcoming staff. A nice change compared to the rest of China town. It's quite a small diner though, may be difficult to get a table.

Tokyo diner is very popular and it's not unusual to queue for a table. The surroundings are basic, but the food is generously portioned, tasty and very reasonably priced. With friendly staff, free green tea and miso soup with each dish ordered, what's not to like? Definitely worth a visit.
Very tasty Maki and good Udon. Small seating area, may have to wait outside, but worth it.

Small diner, seems very authentic, very good portion prices (you can ask for extra noodles or rice at the time of ordering for free) and quick service. Don't take tips as customary in Japan. Be prepared for a little bit of a wait
A very London Chinatown institution.

Have been going regularly for 6+ years and I never grow tired. I really can't find a better Japanese restaurant in London and the curry warms my heart ‚ô•

Delicious, authentic Japanese food, friendly staff and a cosy atmosphere. The minimalistic menu is also a fantastic idea - everything is delicious and reasonably priced. Looking forward to coming here again!

Authentic Japanese diner with a simple menu, but amazing quality. Having lived in Japan for a while, I really appreciate proper Japanese homey food and atmosphere like this. You might need to queue sometimes to get in.
Taste wise there is a room for improvement

I have been coming here for years, one of my favorite places to eat.  On the edge of China town.

Basic, clean, fast, quality Japanese food.  Fast service.  Good value for Soho. Recommend for lunch or as a pit stop.

I think I probably ordered the wrong food as I got the salmon don and it was just ok even for the price. It is very busy and they don‚Äôt have enough staff but you can see they do try their best to get to everyone.

Restaurant has no insurance so could not help.

Be very careful here.

Been around for many years. Good quality food but little over priced.

One of, if not may favourite Japanese Restaurant in London. I walk in here and I think of one of my favourite places to eat in Tokyo, out of the way, lovely and homely. It is a bit moist in there during the summer. Otherwise it's perfect for getting that classic Japanese eat. Would recommend any time of the day, any time of the week

Google tells me I have been here. I have walked past in on numerous occasions. Maybe I stopped outside to tie my shoe lace.  Please ignore the star rating as it probably does not reflect the actual ratings for the restaurant.
Have seen this place busy many times. Finally went on Friday. It didn't disappoint. Delicious chicken katsu and nice service and atmosphere.

Nice friendly staff and food is cheap and authentic. Would recommend!

Love this atmosphere, will definitely go back. The waiters all speak Japanese so it's nice for the people who wants to practice the language. The rooms are beautifully arranged and the food is really enjoyable. You can ask for am extra portion of rice for free if you're really hungry üç£üçöüç≤

Its a veey honest sushi restaurant that serves quality food at a pretty decent prices. They don't serve tuna as a way to protect and preserve it.

100% recommended
Real taste of delicious Japanese food. Will come here if I am missing home. I like the Katsu don!

The best! Amazing food and like being in Japan.
